label: Letter from Olive Legendre, January 11, 1938
description: Letter from Olive Legendre to her sister-in-law, Gertrude Legendre, thanking her for the Christmas gifts and assuring her that their gift is on the way. Olive continues in her letter to deliver news of her brother, Howard’s, position in the Air Force in Texas and the litter of puppies her dog, Popeye, has fathered.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Letter from Olive Legendre to her sister-in-law, Gertrude Legendre, thanking her for the Christmas gifts and assuring her that their gift is on the way. Olive continues in her letter to deliver news of her brother, Howard’s, position in the Air Force in Texas and the litter of puppies her dog, Popeye, has fathered.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
January 11.
Dear Gertie,
Please overlook the choice paper but I can find no other. I started
a letter to you a week ago [in New Orleans] to have it interrupted by a call by a buddy from
San Antonio who was motoring to Florida, when I resurrected the letter later
on it sounded so stale I thought I'd wait until a billet-doux could be redolent
[hows that toots?] with sage brush and the plains of Texas or what have you.
Jimmy, Essie and I arrived here intact two days ago and it is freezing and I 
am disgusted. Jimmys nose is redder than a drunkards and Essie is almost 
white and teeth chattering constantly, if my father were feeling better.I'd 
run right back to warm old New Orleans but I'm here for two weeks at least. 
Gertie I am crazy about the dorine you sent me, it is perfectly 
stunning and we are never separated, thank you a lot. Jimmy loves his blocks
from Landine so much he brought them all over here with him and I left the
Dolly Sisters in raptures over their gifts from Landine. They fancied them-
selves artistes with the paint set and concocted the most grotesque portraits 
of pere Legendre, square face, perch eyes and granite chin, it is too mar-
velous. Kafrum is going to have a "one gal show" and we will have a field 
day when she does another "still life" or two of Armant. You, Sidney and 
Morris must come over, lets set [the arrival] for Washingtons Birthday. I have ordered 
a very handsome present for you and Sidney, in fact wrote away early in 
December for it and shall forward it on when it appears. It is called 
"dancin Dan" and is a black wooden negro who dances divinely with a few 
poundings on a little board. I hope you haven't already seen a "dancin Dan" 
for it took us by storm and you can entertain your Medway guests by the hour. 
I assure you its "somon." It takes a little practice to make Dan keep time  
to jazz on the radio but its well worth the dedication of one half hour so
this noble effort. Hold everything until you see this paragon!
We fe[a]sted on the marvellous cheese from New York, never have
I tasted anything so delicious and knowing what cheese hounds we are you 
[End Page 1]
2.  
can imagine our orgies around the dining-room table, groaning under its weight
of cheese and water crass. I hated to leave New Orleans because there was still
a box of brie as big as the moon---my figure, help, help!! I gained four pounds
as a result and can hardly squeeze into that lovely green evening gown you sent
me. Its so good looking I am playing tennis furiously now to lose those pounds
which stick out under that stream lined dress so prominently. I love the dress
so I refuse to stop wearing it and my father is so delighted to see me in bright
colors again he vows he feels much better. See all the delight you are spread-
ing IF I can just keep thin!
My brother Howard, who is a Lieut. in the Air Corps has been ordered to
Barksdale Field, near Shreveport. We are trying to keep him here at Kelly Field
and you should see me firing wires and letters at the two Texas Senators signed
by my father telling them to get the orders rescinded. Its a picnic and I'm
having more fun than when I used to write them Huey Long was a louse. Howard
has found there is good polo at the field at Shreveport with a civilian team
to "give battle" with the army team and isn't particularly perturbed at the idea
of leaving if the Senators don't change the orders. If he goes he must leave
here in a week and trailing his car will be a horse van or whatever its called
replete with three ponies, it should be quite a sight. I hope those demure
little ranch ponies like the grass near Shreveport, it seems to be his only
concern. He has just given his best girl his pet mare IN FOAL! How if that
isn't ROMANCE what is. Knowing his frugal instincts I enquired further and
discovered said mare was very lame so I don't know just how to index this beau
geste to his lady fair. 
We had a very quiet Christmas. Legume was really ailing with antrim
trouble which is somewhere near the sinus and had to have it punched twice, to
his great discomfort. I really believe his glasses need adjusted, or he should
at least wear his glasses and when he sees his oculist all should be well. He
felt rotten and still does and I did my best to make him dash over to Palm Beach,
descend upon you and Papa John and get some good hot sun. Or at least come over
here where the air is dryer. This place is wonderful for head troubles [sounds
[End Page 2]
3.
like a mental hazard but it isn't that].Anyway he wouldn't listen to me. I
left Mimi and Kafrum at home and that fact alone may force him to sunnier
climes! 
My wonderful Popeye is again a FATHER. All these puppies are blonde
too, in four litters every single puppy has been a pale cream, how do you ac-
count for that, his superior will power? I miss him very much and should
have brought him with me but thought Jimmy enough for this outing.
Thank you again Gertie for that lovely vanity and gifts to our vast
litter of children. By the way Landine wrote them a dashing letter, don't
tell me that babe of a few years can WRITE by now! Surely the nurse must
have printed it or held her hand, if she wrote it I hang my head in shame
for mine are so dumb I can scarcely read their writing now. Armant will
cringe before Sidney in shame. Lots of love to you goophers and please
come over to New Orleans before you get too far from Palm Beach or Medway.
I'm afraid you'll go off on some long trip before I see you both and Moon
Face.
Devotedly,
Olive
[End Page 3]
